name: Jim-Joms Journey To Adventure
description:
Jim-Jom's Journey To Adventure! 

Jim-Jom is a normal guy, who is sick of his 9-5 job, and he wants to seek adventure! He meets some shady people and goes on some fun trips to say the least.

Patch Notes (Major Updates Only) 2w2m1a

First Let's Make Clear The Naming Of The Indev Versions

  • "2w" refers to the week in a given month the version is published
  • "2m" refers to the month the version is published
  • "1" refers to the major version number published during the week
  • "a" refers to minor versions

First Major Release

  • This is the first major release of Jim-Jom's Journey To Adventure
    • As all early projects, this is currently in development, and everything is up for change
    • There will be at least on major release per week (or bi-weekly) with some minor changes for bug fixes or quality of life changes during the week.
    • This version introduces everything

Features

  • Movement
    • Arguably the most important feature
      • WASD / Arrow Keys For Moving
      • Space For Jumping
  • Interaction
    • Interact With Objects
      • Currently On Object In Use
      • Interact With "E"
  • Menu
    • I have finally figured out how to create a working menu in unity!
      • The main menu allows you to enter the secondary menu
        • Press "E" To Enter Secondary Menu
      • The secondary menu will have options for
        • Playing
        • Settings
        • Level Select
      • For now the secondary menu has
        • Play
          • Playing will put you straight into a new game
            • As Of Right Now, The 'New' Game Is Tutorial Level One, And Is Up For Change
        • Settings (Does Not Do Anything Yet)
      • Future Uses Of The Menu
        • Settings
          • Resolution
          • GFX Levels
          • Sound Levels
        • Levels
          • List Of All In Game Levels
            • Allows You To Start From Anywhere (If You Have It Unlocked)

Feedback

  • Please send all feedback to "thirdplace.studios.dev@gmail.com"
    • For Questions
      • Make sure the question is clear and answerable
        • Example
          • "What is the planned release date?" 
    • Bug Reporting
      • Provide As Much Information As Possible
        • Provide A Screenshot (If Possible)
        • Describe The Bug
        • Describe What Led To The Bug
          • (What You Were Doing)
    • Feedback
      • Give us feedback on whatever part of the game you think is good, or whatever needs improved!
